title: Depression: A Brain Disease
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Depression: A Brain Disease.

hook.text: Depression isn't sadness. Brain scans show it physically shrinks the hippocampus and disrupts neural circuits.

buildup.text: Depression involves changes in neurotransmitters, inflammation, and even the brain's physical structure.

discovery.text: It affects concentration, energy, sleep, appetite, and the ability to feel pleasureâ€”not just mood.

twist.text: The simple 'chemical imbalance' theory is outdated. Depression involves complex changes across multiple systems.

climax.text: Treatment worksâ€”therapy, medication, and exercise can reverse brain changes and restore function.

punchline.text: Depression changes the brain. Treatment changes it back.

quiz.question: Why is the 'chemical imbalance' theory of depression considered outdated?
options: Depression involves complex changes across multiple brain systems
Scientists proved neurotransmitters are not involved at all
Only therapy works, proving chemicals play no role
